Package helper.loginactivity

Class LoginActivityLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • helper.loginactivity.LoginActivityLogger
  • public final class LoginActivityLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class with only static methods and not meant to be instantiated. It is used to log log-in attempts to the log file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.lang.String filename
      The file name to log the attempts to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      LoginActivityLogger()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private static void appendToLogFile​(java.lang.String entry)
      Given a string, simply appends to the end of the log file.
      private static void createLogFileIfNotExists()
      Creates the log file.
      private static java.lang.String getFormattedNow()
      Returns the current timestamp in UTC-0, formatted using DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME.
      static void logAttempt​(java.lang.String username, boolean wasLoginSuccessful)
      Given the username and whether the login was successful, logs the result into the log file, creating the file if necessary.

      • logAttempt

        public static void logAttempt​(java.lang.String username,
                              boolean wasLoginSuccessful)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Given the username and whether the login was successful, logs the result into the log file, creating the file if necessary.
        Parameters:
        username - the attempted username.
        wasLoginSuccessful - whether the login was successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if log file could not be created.
        See Also:
        createLogFileIfNotExists()

      • createLogFileIfNotExists

        private static void createLogFileIfNotExists()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the log file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the log file could not be created.
        See Also:
        logAttempt(String, boolean)

      • appendToLogFile

        private static void appendToLogFile​(java.lang.String entry)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Given a string, simply appends to the end of the log file.
        Parameters:
        entry - the string to be logged.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be opened or written to.

      • getFormattedNow

        private static java.lang.String getFormattedNow()
        Returns the current timestamp in UTC-0, formatted using DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME.
        Returns:
        the current formatted instant.
        See Also:
        DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME
